newsitem.title: UK: St Paul has no comment on Minet/Aon talk.
newsitem.headline: St Paul has no comment on Minet/Aon talk.

text.p: U.S. insurer St. Paul Cos Inc on Wednesday declined to comment on market talk that it had sold its London-based broker Minet to U.S. insurance broker Aon Corp.
"That's a rumour and we don't comment on them," St Paul spokeswoman Karen Himle said.
St. Paul said last summer it was reviewing the future of loss-making Minet and confirmed in January that it was in talks with Aon rival Marsh & McLennan on a possible sale.
Minet's London office was passing enquiries about its future on to its U.S. parent, while no-one was immediately available to comment at Aon.
Rumours about Minet have cropped up frequently in recent months, but market talk reached a new level in London and within Minet itself today.
Marsh & McLennan said last month that talks with St. Paul about Minet had become bogged down on the price to be paid for the London company.
Minet was last year ranked the world's ninth largest broker and number four in the UK.
Since St. Paul effectively put Minet on the market last year, the insurance broking world has changed out of all recognition, with two huge deals.
Aon acquired Alexander & Alexander late last year, while last month Marsh & McLennan regained the title of world's largest broker with the acquisition of Johnson & Higgins.
